message: This site archives old Radio Shack catalogs: http://www.radioshackcatalogs.com/

Searching ebay for "Radio Shack vintage" yields some good results.  These earphones have a funny shape, plenty of room for an MP3 player.  http://cgi.ebay.com/vtg-AM-FM-radio-Headphones-TANDY-radio-shack-70s-/300558801123

This is adorable, it is a guide to CB slang, and the form factor is funny.  It is a radio, and you pull up on the telescoping antenna to slide the answer card out.  Maybe do a modern retro version of this for leet-speak or cellphone speak (OMG, LMFAO, etc.)  http://cgi.ebay.com/Vintage-Radio-Shack-Slide-Guide-Chart-Codes-Slangs-/260775305331

These RFID readers are on clearance for $8, but they are in-store only.  Normally they retail for something like $40.  We should try and get these from stores.  The in-stock locator shows stock in some Brooklyn locations.  http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2906723&numProdsPerPage=60
Radio Shack wants to know what 3 products they should start stocking in the store.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JxyDab_s_lY
I voted for Arduino / CNC kit (3d printer / milling / laser cutter all-in-one) / Motors & Sensors
